result.execSummary:
The defendant Gregory J. Schulze was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
DEFENDANT HAS 18 DAYS SENTENCE CREDIT IF REVOKED FROM PROBATION
Concurrent with: 22CF296

miscConds.notes:
Defendant to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended. 
No controlled substances without a valid prescription in defendant's name. 
No drug paraphernalia. 
Obtain/maintain full time employment with agent's approval.

Defendant Gregory J. Schulze in court, in custody.  Attorney Greg A Tainter in court for Gregory J. Schulze.  Attorney Kevin Croninger in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant pleads guilty and is found guilty of count 1. Count 2 dismissed and read in. 18 months probation with conditions. 18 days sentence credit.
